subject: RE: [junit] How to run same testcase with 20 different   arg-values to test diff. results
msgSnippet: ... Problem: that s just one (JUnit) test, when really it s three (logical) tests. J. B. Rainsberger, President, Diaspar Software Services Let s write software
messageBody:
>So said Andrew McDonagh on 2003-07-23 --------------------
>
>Also what about....
>
>
>taking original test case extract the test case code into a private method,
>to which the params are passed. Then in the original test case method, we
>simply call the private one n times with different param values.
>
>Original code:
>
>public void testIntegers() {
>
> assertEquals(Integer.maxValue, Integer.maxValue);
> assertEquals(Integer.minValue, Integer.minValue);
>}
>
>
>would then become...
>
>
>public void testIntegers() {
> testTwoIntegers(Integer.maxValue, Integer.maxValue);
> testTwoIntegers(Integer.minValue, Integer.minValue);
> testTwoIntegers(new Integer(232), new Integer(232));
> ...
>}
>
>
>private void testTwoIntegers(Integer expected, Integer actual) {
> // Setup could even be called from here if needed!
>
> assertEquals(expected, actual);
>
> // If setup is called from here, then you'd no doubt want to cal
>tearDown
>as well
>}

Problem: that's just one (JUnit) test, when really it's three (logical) tests.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
